page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: BATH SPA station handles about 2,500 passengers a day. The station is on an important route between Bristol and London. The line was constructed by I.K.BRUNEL as was the station. Mnay people are able to commute tothe city from the West Country because of the intoduction of the HST which has brought travelling time down to 1 hour 25 mins. The station became important because of the SPA that it served and during Victorian times many people travelled to BATH to take the waters. The station is extremely busy but could do with some investment to look after the comfort of passengers.
